intro: Indosasa sondongensis, commonly known as the Sondong mountain fern, is a rare and endemic species found primarily in the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, serrated margin. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rocky substrates or in dense forest undergrowth. Its spore-producing structures, known as sori, are clustered on the underside of the fronds, a common feature in many fern species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Indosasa sondongensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
